Sure, here are some popular performance monitoring tools for cloud computing platforms that you could consider:

1. Amazon CloudWatch: This is a monitoring and management service by Amazon Web Services (AWS) that provides real-time metrics and logs on resource utilization, application performance, and operational health. It can monitor AWS resources as well as custom metrics. 2. Google Stackdriver: This is a monitoring, logging, and diagnostics platform by Google Cloud Platform that provides real-time visibility into the performance, uptime, and overall health of applications and infrastructure. It can monitor Google Cloud resources as well as hybrid and multi-cloud environments. 3. Datadog: This is a cloud monitoring and analytics platform that provides end-to-end visibility into the performance of applications and infrastructure. It supports monitoring of cloud services, applications, metrics, logs, and traces. 4. New Relic: This is a cloud-based observability platform that provides monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization for cloud and hybrid environments. It supports monitoring of applications, infrastructure, logs, and traces. 5. AppDynamics: This is an application performance monitoring platform that provides visibility into application performance and user experience. It supports monitoring of applications, infrastructure, and business transactions. These are just a few examples, and there are many other performance monitoring tools available in the market. You should evaluate them based on your specific requirements and choose the one that best fits your needs.
